thread.title: Austrian TV pundits "do a Gary Lineker" after Barcelona's epic Champions League comeback against PSG
thread.title_full: Austrian TV pundits "do a Gary Lineker" after Barcelona's epic Champions League comeback against PSG

author: Mark Jones
title: Austrian TV pundits "do a Gary Lineker" after Barcelona's epic Champions League comeback against PSG
text:
Sport Austrian TV pundits "do a Gary Lineker" after Barcelona's epic Champions League comeback against PSG The Austrian TV crew - including former international manager Herbert Prohaska - were forced to strip to their smalls after Barca made the impossible possible Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get FC Barcelona   Thank you for subscribing!   
The whole world is still talking about Barcelona's remarkable comeback win against Paris Saint-Germain in the Champions League, and they probably will do for some time yet. 
Everyone seems to have a story about just what they were doing when Sergi Roberto scored THAT 95th minute winner to break Parisian hearts and send Barca through, and there was probably at least one point in the evening when you said to the person next to you that you didn't think the Catalans were going to do it. 
But crucially, you probably didn't do what the pundits from Austria's ORF Sport did. The boys in their boxers (Photo: ORF Sport) 
Their TV panel - including Austrian legend Herbert Prohaska, a former player for Inter Milan and Roma and the man who led Austria to the 1998 World Cup - claimed that they would "do a Gary Lineker" and strip to their boxers if Barca came back and won. 
And they did. 
Lineker, of course, presented Match of the Day in his pants after his beloved Leicester City won the Premier League last season, but the Austrian panel looked a little bit more sheepish than he did when they showed their smalls at the end of the match. A bet's a bet (Photo: BBC) 
The footage eventually got pulled from ORF Sport, but not before a lot of viewers helpfully recorded the event for posterity. 
Maybe they'll get a move to the BBC next? poll loading Was Barcelona 6-1 PSG the greatest Champions League match ever? 2000+ VOTES SO FAR
